meanings.definition: A powder made from talc, used for keeping the skin dry and for reducing friction.
meanings.sent1: After showering, she applied talcums to her skin to stay dry.
meanings.sent2: Talcums are commonly used in baby powder to prevent diaper rash.
meanings.sent3: The cloud of talcums puffed up like a tiny explosion when she squeezed the bottle.
meanings.sent4: The talcums floated through the air like delicate snowflakes.
meanings.sent5: The soft touch of talcums on the skin felt like a gentle caress.

meanings.definition: To apply talcum powder to the body.
meanings.sent1: She gently talcums her baby after every bath.
meanings.sent2: He talcums his feet before putting on his socks to prevent sweating.
meanings.sent3: The clown talcums his face before the performance, making him look even more comical.
meanings.sent4: She talcums her hands before attempting to climb the rope, ensuring a better grip.
meanings.sent5: The gymnast talcums her palms before the routine, readying herself for the bars.
